Instrument Host Overview ======================== The International Halley Watch was an international effort to coordinate ground-based observations of comet 1P/Halley during its 1986 apparitions, in order to maximize the benefits of ground-based observations and to support the various international flight missions to the comet. The IHW was divided into several disciplines networks, each headed by one or more discipline specialists. The Astrometry Network is one of these discipline networks. The discipline specialists for Astrometry were:
Donald K. Yeomans Jet Propulsion Laboratory Richard M. West European Southern Observatory Robert S. Harrington U.S. Naval Observatory Brian G, Marsden Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics
The goal of the Astrometry Network as to coordinate and archive astrometric observations of 1P/Halley. These data were fed to the orbit determination center at JPL, and the resulting orbit and ephemeris information forwarded to observers and flight missions around the globe. 430 observers working at 148 different observatories contributed observations to the final archive
